title: WAMC News Podcast - Episode 323
dc:creator: WAMC Northeast Public Radio
description: The Colonie Town Board recently passed a local law meant to improve cell phone service in the Capital Region’s largest suburb, in Albany County. The law provides a process by which wireless carriers may apply for permits to add cell nodes to existing poles and structures. We speak with Republican Town Supervisor Peter Crummey about why the measure was needed and much more.

We speak with Republican Town Supervisor Peter Crummey about why the measure was needed and much more.
